description: LongCalc Arbitrary Precision Float and Complex Number Library
releaseNotes:
Unsigned Assembly

Added functions x.toString and x.ToFile for x of type bcr and bcp. Adjusted x.ToFile functions to return results faster when the underlying exponent(s) is of large magnitude.

Modified functions bcr(string...) and bcp(string...) so that the string can specify both parameters of a bcr or bcp object.
Added functions bcr(... FilePath ...) and bcp(... FilePath ...) to initialize bcr or bcp objects from file data.

Adjusted x.Sin, x.Cos, x.Tan for a bf x so that calculation of PI is not required for angles of size |x| less than about 1.4e+1505. Normalizes larger magnitude angles or if PI is already computed to sufficient precision.
Adjusted, so that if the trigonometric functions are calculated on x of type degrees or gradians, normalization of angles always occurs to the input degrees or gradians and calculation of PI is never required.

Corrected some problems in normalizing negative angles.

Corrected some problems in bcp object creation.

Corrected some problems which occured when specifying input or output in base 63 or 64.

Checks for arithmetic overflow or underflow are again compiler-included in this release.
summary: This library, built with and accessible by Visual Studio (2019) and using Mpir.NET for the underlying integer math and requiring .NetFramework4.5, supplies a variety of math functions and utilities with precisions as large as 2,000,000 base 10 digits when running in x86 mode and much larger in x64 mode. The underlying objects are bf (for 'big float') real values comprised of an mpz_t extended integer part from Mpir.NET and a base 2 exponent, bcr (for complex numbers expressed in the rectangular coordinates) comprised of a bf real part and a bf imaginary part, and bcp (for complex numbers expressed in the polar coordinates) comprised of a bf radius and a bf angle). Functions supported include real and complex versions of: basic arithmetic, trigonometric functions, log and exponential functions, hyperbolic functions and the inverses of all of these, base conversions between bases up to 64, conversions between rectangular and polar coordinates, and some special functions such as Euler, Bernoulli, Gamma, Zeta, and BesselJ. The library also includes a 'bd' (for bigdecimal) object with fractional base 10 digits up to long.MaxValue.
title: LongCalc Arbitrary Precision Float and Complex Number Library
